alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 2:17PM CDT until May 26 at 9:10AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County. For the Whitewater River...including Towanda, Augusta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Whitewater River at Towanda. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, The river will be out of its banks on both sides. West bank overflows impact cropland mainly in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 22.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Whitewater River Towanda 22.0 3.2 Tue 1 pm CDT 20.0 14.3 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
